meanings.definition: A sudden or forceful upward movement
meanings.sent1: The upthrusts of the rocket were powerful and impressive.
meanings.sent2: The mountain's upthrusts created a breathtaking landscape.
meanings.sent3: The upthrusts of the balloon made it soar higher than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement felt like an upthrusts propelling her forward.
meanings.sent5: The upthrusts of the geyser sprayed water high into the air.

meanings.sent1: The gymnast's upthrusts during the routine were flawless.
meanings.sent2: His upthrusts in the dance routine added a dynamic element.
meanings.sent3: The upthrusts of the dancer seemed to defy gravity.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an upthrusts pushing her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The upthrusts of the elevator brought them to the top floor swiftly.

meanings.sent1: The upthrusts of the water pushed the boat gently along.
meanings.sent2: The upthrusts of the air balloon lifted it off the ground.
meanings.sent3: The upthrusts of the pillow made it fluffier and more comfortable.
meanings.sent4: His words had an upthrusts that inspired everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The upthrusts of the crowd carried the singer's voice across the stadium.
